issues.description: The problem statement and the solution expect a Stock.findStockIngredient(String) method (single String parameter) but the template Stock.java declares only findStockIngredient(String, boolean). Meanwhile the template's add(...) and take(...) methods call findStockIngredient(ingredient) (single-argument), which does not match the declared two-argument signature — this creates a compile error and prevents students from implementing SealSaloon as described.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template Stock API consistent with the UML/problem and solution by providing a single-argument findStockIngredient(String) method. Either (a) add an overload public StockIngredient findStockIngredient(String name) that delegates to the two-arg method (e.g., treating case-sensitivity appropriately), or (b) change the existing declaration to public StockIngredient findStockIngredient(String name) (remove the boolean). Ensure add(...) and take(...) call the matching single-argument method so the template compiles and matches the specification.

issues.description: The problem text gives conflicting instructions about the SealSaloon.stock attribute: it first asks for a final Stock initialized in the instance constructor (instance-final), but later requires that stock be static (shared across instances). Declaring a static final field and saying it must be initialized in the instance constructor is contradictory (static final must be initialized at declaration or in a static initializer). This conflict can confuse students about whether stock should be instance or static and where to initialize it.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify and align the specification with the intended design. Either (A) require a static (shared) stock: state that stock should be declared static final and initialized at declaration or in a static initializer (as in the solution), or (B) require an instance-level final stock and remove the static requirement. Update the problem text accordingly (remove the instruction to initialize the static final stock in the instance constructor). Ensure the template and examples match the clarified requirement.

issues.description: The problem statement's UML and the solution both specify Stock.findStockIngredient(String) (single String parameter), but the template's Stock.java declares findStockIngredient(String name, boolean caseSensitive) (an extra boolean parameter). The template also calls findStockIngredient(...) without the boolean in add(String), which creates a mismatch between the UML/specification and the provided starter code. This signature divergence can confuse students mapping the UML to code and may produce compilation or usage confusion (they may expect a single-parameter method as shown in the problem UML).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template Stock API match the UML and solution by providing a single-parameter method: public StockIngredient findStockIngredient(String name). Either remove the boolean-parameter variant or overload it by adding public StockIngredient findStockIngredient(String name) (and implement a sensible default behavior). Also ensure uses of findStockIngredient(...) in the template call the matching signature.
